body: Lol I now usually use my laptop and need a mouse.  What good gaming mouse should I buy?  Try to keep it a bit cheap because I have a budget. :P
body_tagged: Lol I now usually use my laptop and need a mouse.  What good gaming mouse should I buy?  Try to keep it a bit cheap because I have a budget. :P
title: What mouse should I buy?

replies.body: http://www.amazon.com/Redragon-M601-CENTROPHORUS-2000-Buttons-Switches/dp/B00HTK1NCS/ref=sr_1_1?ie=U... Best gaming mouse for this price
replies.body_tagged: http://www.amazon.com/Redragon-M601-CENTROPHORUS-2000-Buttons-Switches/dp/B00HTK1NCS/ref=sr_1_1?ie=U... Best gaming mouse for this price

replies.body: Best gaming mouse overal G502. But I would recommend a Deathadder if you are only going to play Minecraft pvp. Only prob, many people says they broke a few days after buying so I would recommend trying the mouse at a shop first and stuff
replies.body_tagged: Best gaming mouse overal G502. But I would recommend a Deathadder if you are only going to play Minecraft pvp. Only prob, many people says they broke a few days after buying so I would recommend trying the mouse at a shop first and stuff

replies.body:
Most people say that they break around 6 months of usage, which is quite lame for any type of mouse.

@OP: If you want a gaming mouse, please, please, I cannot stress this enough, we need more information than "I want a gaming mouse."

At least say what type of games you play the most (FPS, MOBA, MMO, RTS, and so on) and an approximate budget!

replies.body: I Like The Razer Deathadder Chroma :)
replies.body_tagged: I Like The Razer Deathadder Chroma :)

replies.body: Logitech G600 if you're gonna play a crap ton of games ranging from Minecraft, Btd 5, Sas 3/4, Maple story or any MMO, or even Web browsing! I've owned one since 2012 and it works all fine. Only concern is managing the profiles, since there's so much.
replies.body_tagged: Logitech G600 if you're gonna play a crap ton of games ranging from Minecraft, Btd 5, Sas 3/4, Maple story or any MMO, or even Web browsing! I've owned one since 2012 and it works all fine. Only concern is managing the profiles, since there's so much.

replies.body: 'Bout 75 dollars, sir.  But I dunno if they sell them for 75 dollars anyway...

replies.body: If you really, really want to spend $75 dollars, get the Logitech G502. If you play a lot of MMOs and RPGs, get the Logitech 600. If you just want to spend $15, get the Redragon I linked earlier, based on reviews and friends' testimonials, I can highly recommend it.
replies.body_tagged: If you really, really want to spend $75 dollars, get the Logitech G502. If you play a lot of MMOs and RPGs, get the Logitech 600. If you just want to spend $15, get the Redragon I linked earlier, based on reviews and friends' testimonials, I can highly recommend it.

replies.body: Yeah, I ordered it and can confirm that it is a quality mouse. The only thing that I had a small problem with was right-clicking can be pretty problematic while left-clicking when you first get it. Once it wears down a bit, however, it's nothing to stress about. Just give it a few days ^-^

replies.body:
Given this Budget, the best mice you could probably buy (I factor in DPI, flair, durability, and functionality):

Overall gaming: Logitech G502

MMO/MOBAs: Logitech G600

FPSs: Corsair K65 (own this, AMA if you want)

Wireless: I'd say Logitech G700s; some others might disagree and go with Logitech G602.

Ambidexterous: Steelseries Sensei
replies.body_tagged:
Given this Budget, the best mice you could probably buy (I factor in DPI, flair, durability, and functionality):

Overall gaming: Logitech G502

MMO/MOBAs: Logitech G600

FPSs: Corsair K65 (own this, AMA if you want)

Wireless: I'd say Logitech G700s; some others might disagree and go with Logitech G602.

Ambidexterous: Steelseries Sensei
